H0.text: Renewable is the type of resource exemplified by trees, which can be planted and harvested.

H1.text: Electric is the type of resource that trees, which can be planted and harvested, are an example of.

H2.text: Fossil is the type of resource that trees, which can be planted and harvested, are an example of.

H3.text: Geothermal is a type of resource exemplified by trees that can be planted and harvested.

A4.text: Sustainable harvesting and use of renewable resources (i.e., maintaining a positive renewal rate) can reduce air pollution, soil contamination, habitat destruction and land degradation.

A5.text: Biomass is referring to biological material from living, or recently living organisms, most often referring to plants or plant-derived materials.
